attributes.title: The Blob (1988) is a Gory, Cheesy, Special Effects Masterpiece - 30 Morbid Movie Club
attributes.caption: A cult classic of gooey greatness.
attributes.description:

attributes.title: Phrogging 101: What to do if a Stranger is Secretly Living in Your Walls
attributes.caption: Phrogging is not what you think it is.
attributes.description:
The thought of someone 'phrogging' -- living in you home, maybe in the crawlspace or walls -- without your knowledge or permission, is a terrifying one. We recount some of real life horror stories of this happening, and what you can do to detect unscrupulous phroggers in your home.

Support us directly and get cool (and spooky) perks: 30mm.show/first



This episode is sponsored by BetterHelp — go to http://betterhelp.com/30MM to get 10% off your first month.

attributes.display_title: S8:E2 - Phrogging 101: What to do if a Stranger is Secretly Living in Your Walls

attributes.title: Why We Shouldn't Try To Contact Aliens
attributes.caption: Are they already living among us?
attributes.description:
If other earth-like planets exist, there's a very real chance that some have developed intelligent life. If so, are our alien friends out there, but scared to communicate? Hidden from the general public by top secret government agencies? Or already living among us?  We cover last July's congressional testimony, Dark Forest and Great Filter theories, and more. 



Go to http://meundies.com/30mm to get 25% off your first order plus free shipping.

attributes.title: Lightning (Sometimes) Strikes Twice: History's Unluckiest People
attributes.caption: History's poor souls who just can't catch a break.
attributes.description:
From Adolphe Sax, the blighted and beleaguered inventor of the saxophone, to Ann Hodges, who holds the distinction of being the only documented human hit by a meteorite, we pour one out for history's poor souls who just can't seem to catch a break.

attributes.title: Mothman is the Sexiest Cryptid - Featuring Sinisterhood
attributes.caption: Welcome our friends from the Sinisterhood Podcast!
attributes.description:
What began as West Virginia folklore has since evolved into a red-eyed, caked-up, wide-winged sex symbol... It's the Mothman! We discuss whether Mothman is actually the harbinger of doom, or a passive ally with a bridge obsession. Please welcome our friends and guests Christie and Heather from the Sinisterhood Podcast! 



Go to https://mistymountaingaming.com and use code 30MM to get a FREE acrylic dice set of your choice when you spend $20 or more.

attributes.title: Ghost Stories During Christmas: A Victorian Tradition We Need to Bring Back
attributes.caption: A little taste of yuletide terror.
attributes.description:
Gathering around the fire and telling ghost stories during the holiday season was extremely in vogue during the Victorian Era. We explore how a tradition of yuletide terror came to be, and the authors behind it.



Go to http://shadyrays.com and use code 30MM for 50% off 2 or more pairs of polarized sunglasses.

attributes.title: How to Clean Before You Die: The Gentle Art of Swedish Death Cleaning
attributes.caption: Help with your death cleaning while you're alive!
attributes.description:
Don't expect your loved ones to preserve your home like a shrine when you die -- help them with your death cleaning while you're still alive! We discuss Margareta Magnusson's seminal guide on how to organize your life and preemptively lighten the burden on your loved ones when your time comes. 



Go to http://factormeals.com/30mm50 and use code 30mm50 to get 50% off.

attributes.title: Inside Body Farms with a Future Resident
attributes.caption: Body farms allow forensic scientists and law enforcement to conduct research on decomposing cadavers, as a means to help solve future murders. Learn what happens at these facilities, and why donating your body is all the rage (spoiler, it's a green alternative!). Plus, our editor Kelly Reynolds joins us to share their process for becoming a future donor.
attributes.description: Body farms allow forensic scientists and law enforcement to conduct research on decomposing cadavers, as a means to help solve future murders.
